The film tells the inspiring true story of Władysław Szpilman, a Polish Jewish pianist who struggles to survive during WWII. Alternatively, if you're interested in a more character-driven drama, "The Best Years of Our Lives" (1946) is a powerful exploration of three World War II veterans as they readjust to civilian life, featuring iconic performances from Dana Andrews and Myrna Loy.

I think I have just the film for you! "We Were Soldiers" (2002) is a powerful and intense war drama that explores the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War. Directed by Randall Wallace, this film features an all-star cast including Mel Gibson, Jon Hamm, and Chris Klein, and offers a gripping look at the sacrifices made on both sides of the conflict.

Alternatively, if you're looking for something a bit more historical in nature, "Windtalkers" (2002) is another great option. This film tells the true story of Navajo Code Talkers who used their native language to transmit secret messages during World War II, and stars Nicolas Cage alongside Brian Van Holt and Martin Henderson.

I think I can help you with that! Since you mentioned Valkyrie and didn't expect a certain vibe, I'm going to recommend two movies from this list that might surprise you in a good way.

Firstly, have you considered "Kingdom of Heaven"? It's an epic historical drama that explores the Crusades, and it has a great cast, including Liam Neeson and Orlando Bloom. The story is complex and thought-provoking, and I think you'll find it engaging.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something more lighthearted, "Frankenweenie" might be just the ticket! It's a heartwarming and humorous tale of a boy who tries to bring his beloved dog back to life, with a great cast of quirky characters.
